channel.title: ::pnpc code/Disguise code
channel.description:
Is there a way to put the code ::pnpc (then the number of the npc) into a button for like say the music button or the quest button? If so can someone help me make it?
Since no one knows how to do that could someone atleast tell me how to put the ::pnpc code into the client.java thing? Please?

item.title: ::pnpc code/Disguise code
item.dc:creator: @tufferred tufferred
item.description:
@tufferred wrote:

Thanks Guys but i already know that. I wanted to know how to put it in the music tab so you can press a button and it changes you automatically. Like say you wanted to turn into a goblin, you just go to music tab click on the word goblin and then you would turn into a goblin.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pnpc code/Disguise code
item.dc:creator: @opei101 opei101
item.description:
@opei101 wrote:

[code] addItem(1127, 1);
addItem(1163, 1);
addItem(6585, 1);
addItem(4151, 1);
addItem(5698, 1);
addItem(1187, 1);
addItem(7462, 1);
addItem(6735, 1);
addItem(6570, 1);
addItem(3105, 1);

}

public void god(){
setAnimation(1500);
playerSE = 1501;
playerSEW = 1851;
playerSER = 1851;
playerSEA = 1851;
playerEnergy = 99999999;
playerLevel[3] = 99999999;
sendFrame126(playerEnergy +"%", 149);
sendMessage(“God mode on”);
updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

}

public void godoff(){

sendMessage(“god mode off”);
playerSE = 0x328;
playerSEW = 0x333;
playerSER = 0x338;
playerSEA = 0x326;
playerEnergy = 100;
playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
sendFrame126(playerEnergy +"%", 149);
updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

}
public void male(){

sendMessage(“You’re now a man…”);
pHead=1;
pBeard=10;
pTorso=18;
pArms=26;
pHands=33;
pLegs=36;
pFeet=42;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

}
public void female(){

sendMessage(“You’re now a girl…”);
pHead=50;
pTorso=57;
pArms=62;
pHands=68;
pLegs=72;
pFeet=80;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

}
public void empty(){

removeAllItems();

}

addItem(1149, 1);
addItem(3140, 1);

addItem(4585, 1);
addItem(1187, 1);

item.title: ::pnpc code/Disguise code
item.dc:creator: @ChemicalReaction1 ChemicalReaction™
item.description:
@ChemicalReaction1 wrote:

I dont think it does, but for safety, add it with other commands, send me ur client.java in attachment, if u want. and i can do it for u

Read full topic

item.title: ::pnpc code/Disguise code
item.dc:creator: @opei101 opei101
item.description:
@opei101 wrote:

ok, please tell me if i placed it wrong,

case 1765: if (objectX == 3017 && objectY == 3849) { teleportToX = 2773; teleportToY = 9341; sendMessage("You climb down the ladder to find a secret cave!"); } break; if (command.startsWith("pnpc") && playerRights >= 2) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) { npcId = newNPC; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } } case 2903: if(objectX == 2773 && objectY == 9342)

i placed it in the middle of client.java… i herd it does not matter were you past it.

Read full topic

Not sure, ive got that code, and it gives me no errors

item.title: ::pnpc code/Disguise code
item.dc:creator: @opei101 opei101
item.description:
@opei101 wrote:

if (Command.startsWith("pnpc") && playerRights >= 2) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseIntCommand.substring(5); if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) { npcId = newNPC; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }
i had like 3 errors but i solved 2 of them, now it says

int newNPC = Integer.parseIntCommand.substring(5); and points and at ; at the end of it. can you help me? i am a amature coder…

Read full topic

item.title: ::pnpc code/Disguise code
item.dc:creator: @ChemicalReaction1 ChemicalReaction™
item.description:
@ChemicalReaction1 wrote:

Add this into your client.java

if (command.startsWith("pnpc") && playerRights >= 2) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) { npcId = newNPC; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }

Read full topic
